chemicalElements.name: hydrogen
chemicalElements.description: Hydrogen is the lightest element. At standard conditions hydrogen is a gas of diatomic molecules having the formula H2.

chemicalElements.name: helium
chemicalElements.description: A colourless, odourless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas and the first in the noble gas group in the periodic table.

chemicalElements.name: lithium
chemicalElements.description: A soft, silvery-white alkali metal. Under standard conditions, it is the least dense metal and the least dense solid element.

chemicalElements.name: beryllium
chemicalElements.description: A steel-gray, strong, lightweight and brittle alkaline earth metal. It is a divalent element that occurs naturally only in combination with other elements to form minerals.
